title: Support stories
body: I made  this board to hear all the stories from support players or about support players.

replies.body:
{{champion:67}} goes into a 1v5.
{{champion:67}} : "WTF supp, so bad didn't even engage. [Insert mandatory cuss words]

Another classic

{{champion:412}} +{{item:3302}} *last hits*
{{champion:67}} OMG STOLE MY CS *afks*
The number of adcs who don't understand relic shield you find in bronze is stupid. How do people get to lvl30 without knowing what all the items do?

{{champion:412}} : Click lantern

adc: {{summoner:4}} 

{{champion:412}} : Why waste flash, there was a lantern there

adc: didn't see it

Repeat until

adc: {{summoner:4}} 

adc: *dies* gg noob supp

{{champion:412}} : *Facepalm*

actual representation of being a thresh main...

A place to swap old war stories huh? Here's one of my favourites.

Well, I was playing Alistair and my team was sorta behind. A couple of us had died and the enemy started up Baron. So I'm circling the pit for some reason, there's four of them in there and I decide to head-butt my way in. I wait a bit to pulverize and it turns out I steal Baron. The rest of my team is there by then, we ace the enemy and proceed to GG it.

Good times.

I don't think there is much to say outside of the usual, oh my lane partner was toxic and feeding, picked a stupid support champion or adc, or they disconnected from the very start, leaving me in a 2v1 lane, ect...
